comment: Smart Data Models - ExternalNetworkInjection adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/ExternalNetworkInjection/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. This class represents external network and it is used for IEC 60909 calculations.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: governorSCD
contents.comment: Power Frequency Bias. This is the change in power injection divided by the change in frequency and negated.  A positive value of the power frequency bias provides additional power injection upon a drop in frequency. Default: 0.0

contents.name: ikSecond
contents.comment: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik`). Default: False

contents.name: maxInitialSymShCCurrent
contents.comment: Maximum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik` max) in A (Ik` = Sk`/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Default: 0.0

contents.name: maxP
contents.comment: Maximum active power of the injection. Default: 0.0

contents.name: maxQ
contents.comment: Not for short circuit modelling; It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange. If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used Default: 0.0

contents.name: maxR0ToX0Ratio
contents.comment: Maximum ratio of zero sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its zero sequence reactance (R(0)/X(0) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Default: 0.0

contents.name: maxR1ToX1Ratio
contents.comment: Maximum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Default: 0.0

contents.name: maxZ0ToZ1Ratio
contents.comment: Maximum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Default: 0.0

contents.name: minInitialSymShCCurrent
contents.comment: Minimum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik` min) in A (Ik` = Sk`/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Default: 0.0

contents.name: minP
contents.comment: Minimum active power of the injection. Default: 0.0

contents.name: minQ
contents.comment: Not for short circuit modelling; It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange. If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used Default: 0.0

contents.name: minR0ToX0Ratio
contents.comment: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik`). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 6090 Default: 0.0

contents.name: minR1ToX1Ratio
contents.comment: Minimum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Default: 0.0

contents.name: minZ0ToZ1Ratio
contents.comment: Minimum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909 Default: 0.0

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: p
contents.comment: Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions. Default: 0.0

contents.name: q
contents.comment: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions. Default: 0.0

contents.name: referencePriority
contents.comment: Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on. Default: 0

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: voltageFactor
contents.comment: Voltage factor in pu, which was used to calculate short-circuit current Ik` and power Sk`. Default: 0.0

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
